avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Weak windslab will become deeper and more extensive on all steep South West through North to North East aspects above 950m. Weak cornices will continue to build over all the above locations. Much better stability on all ridges and windward aspects where firm or crusty snow ice is widespread above 850m.  The avalanche hazard will be Considerable.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Strong East South Easterly airflow will continue. Snow showers throughout the period. Remaining cold.
Observed Weather Influences: Some overnight snow showers then generally dry. Cold throughout. Moderate East South East winds.
ObservedSnowStability: Good stability in all wind exposed locations where hard or crusty conditions prevail. However, snow continued to drift even in the absence of snowfall and weak windslab was beginning to gain depth on steep South West to North aspects above 950m. Cross loading has affected the top of selected steep North East facing gullies above the same altitude. Some minor weak cornice development noted high above steeper lee slopes.  The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Unstable windslab will continue to develop and gain depth through the period. Greatest accumulations will be on West to North aspects above 1000 metres with more localised deposits on South-West and North-East aspects and at lower elevations. Due to variable nature of recent winds isolated pockets of windslab possible on any aspect. Fragile cornices will continue to build. The older snowpack will be well bonded and stable. The avalanche hazard will be Considerable.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Snow above around 800 metres, heaviest during the morning. Gale force mainly Easterly winds, but with some variability in direction, will decrease slightly through the day.
Observed Weather Influences: A few snow showers above around 800 metres on variable but mostly East-South-Easterly Gale force winds.
ObservedSnowStability: The older snowpack is well bonded and stable with a firm breakable crust. Localised deposits of unstable windslab possible on most aspects due to variations in wind. Greatest windslab accumulations are in gullies and coire rims on West to North aspects above 1000 metres. Fragile cornices in these locations. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Unstable windslab will become deeper and more widespread on steep West to North aspects above 850 metres, where avalanches will occur. South-West and North-East aspects will also be affected by cross loading. Crag aprons, gully tops and coire rims will be especially affected, with localised instabilities presenting on steep banks and burn lines at lower elevations. Cornices will present an ongoing threat of collapse. The avalanche hazard will be Considerable.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Snowfall is expected throughout the forecast period, generally above 700 metres. Gale force winds will be mainly from the South-East and East-South-East. The freezing level will be between 700 and 800 metres for much of the period.
Observed Weather Influences: Precipitation throughout the period fell as snow above around 600 metres. Gale force winds were predominantly from the South-East. The freezing level was around 700 metres at midday.
ObservedSnowStability: Unstable windslab is present on South-West through North to North-East aspects above 850 metres. Steep wind sheltered locations are mostly affected such as coire rims, gully tops and crag aprons. At lower elevations between 600 metres and 850 metres, localised instabilities are present in drifts and steep terrain features. Wind scoured areas are very firm and icy. Fresh, fragile cornices are present above similar aspects to those above. The avalanche hazard is Considerable.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Weakly bonded windslab will continue to develop gaining depth becoming more widespread. West to North aspects above 900 metres will be most affected, SW and NE aspects may also be affected due to cross loading and wind variability. Fragile cornices will develop above these aspects. Wind exposed slopes will be scoured with better stability. The avalanche hazard will be Considerable.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: The freezing level will be around 800 metres. Snow showers through the period, heaviest in the morning falling mainly above 650 metres. Winds will be Strong mostly Easterly but occasionally East-South-Easterly.
Observed Weather Influences: Overnight and this morning scattered precipitation which fell as light snow mainly above 750 metres with rain and milder conditions at lower elevations. The freezing level was around 800 metres. Winds were variable but mostly East-South-Easterly with another morning of poor visibility.
ObservedSnowStability: Further deposits of moderately bonded windslab are present in wind sheltered areas such as gully tops and coire rims. West through North to North-Easterly aspects above 900 metres are most affected. Cornices are fragile on same aspects. Elsewhere the snowpack stability is generally good. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Further snowfall and drifting of deposits will continue to form unstable windslab in wind sheltered locations on West to North aspects above 900 metres where avalanches are likely. South-West and some North-East aspects will also be affected. Moderately bonded windslab will be present below this altitude and above 700 metres. Fragile cornices will continue to develop. Slopes exposed to the wind will be scoured and icy. The avalanche hazard will be Considerable.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Precipitation throughout the period, falling as snow, mainly above 700 metres. Winds will be strong East-South-Easterly. Freezing level fluctuating between 700 and 800 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: Persistent precipitation throughout the period, settling as wet snow at 600 metres, drier above. Gale force East-South-Easterly winds. Freezing level around 750 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Snowfall and constant drifting have continued to build unstable windslab in wind sheltered locations on West to North aspects above 900 metres. South-West aspects and some North-East aspects have also been affected due to cross-loaded deposits. Moderately bonded accumulations present below this altitude and above 700 metres. Fragile cornices have formed. Slopes exposed to the winds are scoured and icy.  The avalanche hazard is Considerable.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Snowpack stability will becgenerally good. Remaining cornices present a reduced threat and are mostly stable. The patchy snow cover above around 500 metres will become progressively more firm, icy and extensive with height. The avalanche hazard will be Low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Dry throughout the period with gale force Easterly winds which will ease only slightly by the end of the day. The freezing level will rise from 600 metres in the evening to around 800 metres by the end of the day.
Observed Weather Influences: It was dry throughout the forecast period with very strong to gale force Easterly winds. The freezing level was around 700 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: The snowpack is generally well bonded and stable. Above 500 metres the snow cover is patchy, though more extensive, firm and icy above around 700 metres. The avalanche hazard is Low.
